args: Whoa... So this is a rokkan village.
I heard this place and its ironwork is every\nbit the equal of Hinomotoan swordsmiths,\nand now I see why folks say that.
Pardon me, Mitsuba, but why exactly have\nwe switched into these clothes and come\nto inspect a random rokkan outpost?
We're here to purchase what we're gonna\nneed to master the art of outdoor cooking.
According to what Lazry said, it should be\nriiiight arooooound... Ah, there it is!\nThis is our stop.
That's right! She says it's a specialty place\nthat only sells cookware made with rokkan\nsmithing techniques.
Rokkan iron is famous for its sturdiness,\nwhich should make it perfect for camping.
So we've come to buy the best\ncookware for outdoor work, eh?
I'm very particular about my gear.\nIf you're going to cook, you can't cut\na single corner.
Corner-cutting is an insult to both the\nfood and the people who eat it!
Very well. However, let us be certain\nnot to break our budget, yes?

Are you kidding? I come from a struggling
restaurant! I am the MASTER of thrift!
My belt is tighter than Ranzal's pants
after he visits a buffet!

It's very reassuring to hear...most of that.
Now as the Halidom's bulwark against 
reckless spending, let us put our miserly
heads together and shop wisely!
Look, Mitsuba! Apparently you can put this\niron plate right on the fire and then eat\nstraight off it without burning yourself!
Ahhh! And this super tiny tool lets\nyou smoke an entire haunch of meat!
This shop is like a veritable treasure trove\nof handy tools and utensils.
Right? Er, and since they'd ALSO be super\nhandy to have around the Halidom,\nwe should probably buy 'em all, right?
Hmm. In principle, I do not enjoy\nspending lavishly like this, but...

Oh, believe me, I'm the same way.
But since we'll use this forever, it's
basically a long-term investment!
...Right?
Very good, ladies. Here is your total.
I didn't even know you could put that many\nzeros at the end of something...
It appears we have underestimated the\nprice of rokkan ironware rather severely.
I fear we won't be able to afford\nmore than a single piece.
Well then, let's decide which one it'll be.
Whatever we buy will be linked to our\ncooking lives for years to come.\nWe must choose carefully.
Okay. Then on the count of three,\nwe'll each yell out what we want.

Skewers? That's absurd! If you wish to
roast something, you can simply place
it on some wire mesh and hang it over
an open fire!
Ex-CUSE me?! Are you really standing\nthere throwing shade on ROASTING?!

You just want scissors! SCISSORS, CLEO!
Hell, Notte probably has an old pair of
those just lying around! How will that
possibly change your cooking experience?!
Oh, how naive you are, Mitsuba...\nFor these are no ordinary shears!

In addition to being, as you say, ＂scissors,＂
they can also be separated and used as a
pair of prep knives—one for meat and
one for vegetables!
Cooking utensils live and die by their\nconvenience, and we must make the\nmost practical choice!

Are you nuts?! Cooking needs specificity!
If you're going to spend money, do it on
tools that let you make your dishes the
right way—the ONLY way.
Excuse me, ladies, but your frantic wailing\nis beginning to disturb the other guests.\nMight you kindly take this outside?
And you're just a...a MULE!\nBut still, the—
Stop. I know what you are going to say.\nThe passion you have for cooking...
Cooking makes fools of us all.\nOh, but more importantly, Cleo,\nI think I have a suggestion...
If we're only buying one thing...\nI think we should go with this.

A pot? ...Mmm, yes, that is rather nice.
It's made with a rare iron-casting method,
and is durable, lightweight, and quick
to conduct heat.
AND the lid is made with high-quality iron,\nwhich means you can use it to steam stuff\nover a charcoal fire.
I imagine we could even use the lid as a\nskillet if we were to simply flip it over.
Right? With this one tool, we can roast,\nsteam, and stew all in one.
It lets us do things the right way AND it\nis convenient—which makes it the item\nwe both desire most.
We will make so many delicious meals\nin you, Mr. Pot!
I think that's all of my bags. Mitsuba.\nAre you done getting ready?
(I'm going to find what I need to surpass\nDad this time... I swear I am!)
